history.proof: intros d H. induction H. - apply 0. - apply (S IHmon).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall d : nat, mon d -> nat

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d)
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
mon_rect : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Type, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_rec : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Set, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Prop, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> SProp, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_double_ind : forall R : nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, R 0 n) -> (forall n : nat, R (S n) 0) -> (forall n m : nat, R n m -> R (S n) (S m)) -> forall n m : nat, R n m
Nat.case_analysis : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
exists_between_ind : forall (Q : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), (forall l : nat, exists_between Q k l -> P l -> P (S l)) -> (forall l : nat, k <= l -> Q l -> P (S l)) -> forall n : nat, exists_between Q k n -> P n
Nat.double_induction : forall R : nat -> nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq iff)) R -> (forall m : nat, R 0 m) -> (forall n : nat, R (S n) 0) -> (forall n m : nat, R n m -> R (S n) (S m)) -> forall n m : nat, R n m
Nat.induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A n -> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
Nat.two_dim_induction : forall R : nat -> nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq iff)) R -> R 0 0 -> (forall n m : nat, R n m -> R n (S m)) -> (forall n : nat, (forall m : nat, R n m) -> R (S n) 0) -> forall n m : nat, R n m
le_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), P n -> (forall m : nat, n <= m -> P m -> P (S m)) -> forall n0 : nat, n <= n0 -> P n0
Nat.bi_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A n <-> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
P_nth_ind : forall (P Q : nat -> Prop) (init : nat) (P0 : nat -> nat -> Prop), P0 init 0 -> (forall k l n : nat, P_nth P Q init k n -> P0 k n -> between P (S k) l -> Q l -> P0 l (S n)) -> forall n n0 : nat, P_nth P Q init n n0 -> P0 n n0
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
Inductive exists_between (Q : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) : nat -> Prop := exists_S : forall l : nat, exists_between Q k l -> exists_between Q k (S l) | exists_le : forall l : nat, k <= l -> Q l -> exists_between Q k (S l) Arguments exists_between _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments exists_S _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments exists_le _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
exists_in_int : forall (Q : nat -> Prop) (k l : nat), exists_between Q k l -> exists2 m : nat, in_int k l m & Q m
VectorEq.eqb : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> bool) -> forall m n : nat, VectorDef.t A m -> VectorDef.t A n -> bool
VectorDef.cons : forall A : Type, A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n)
Ndigits.ByteV2N = fun n : nat => Basics.compose Ndigits.Bv2N ByteVector.to_Bvector : forall n : nat, ByteVector.ByteVector n -> BinNums.N Arguments Ndigits.ByteV2N {n}%nat_scope
Inductive between (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) : nat -> Prop := bet_emp : between P k k | bet_S : forall l : nat, between P k l -> P l -> between P k (S l) Arguments between _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bet_emp _%function_scope _%nat_scope Arguments bet_S _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_1_r_nonneg : forall n : nat, 0 <= n -> Nat.divide n 1 -> n = 1

```coq
intros d H.
induction H.
- exact 0.
- simpl. exact (S IHmon).
Qed.
```
